intro: Lapeirousia plicata subsp. effurcata, commonly known as the Cape orchid, is a bulbous perennial plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant produces clusters of pale blue or white flowers with a distinctive, spurred lip. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and rockeries.
